column4: MasterOfDsaster: I have 1 GB of RAM, 200 at most is used out of that, 2 GB of swap is empty, yet ubuntu still keeps reading from HD all the time.
MasterOfDsaster: There's about 0.3 to 2 second delay for most operations, and it may not sound like a lot but when everything happens half a second late it gets kind of annoying.
MasterOfDsaster: Plus boot takes over a minute, I'm not sure why. I used to boot in 20 seconds, even with this installation about 3 days ago.
MasterOfDsaster: So maybe I've accidentally enabled some super economical memory use feature or slowed my computer down somehow? I'm really quite confused.
hard disk DMA, or grapics acceleration
MasterOfDisaster: check the nvidia graphics driver is installed, could be lack of graphics acceleration
I have an "nvidia accelerated graphics driver" that is in use.
ok, also check there is a swap partition and its size
I have 2 GB swap partition, 0 bytes of it used.
try running "top" in a terminal window and checking if any process is using a high PU
CPU sorry
wtf? why did you recompile synaptic?
use "top" first
The process manager? Everything looks fine to me. The CPU's at about 1% occasionally jumping to 5%.
of my 1GB memory about 360mb is full.
ok, that sounds good. Could you please list all the symptoms you see of the slowness you are talking about (except booting)?

Right clicking something on the desktop makes the laptop read from HDD for about 2 seconds, even after that it still takes from half a second to one to display the same right click menu. Switching between windows is slow, again 05 to 2 seconds, sometimes I can actually see the window being drawn.
Also when I click the menus on top ofthe screen they can take anywhere from 1 to 4 seconds to finish loading the icons.
Again, the submenus themselves appear after about a second... I'd expect that at least to be instantaneous.
By the way, the reason I mention netbeans is that my 8 month old windows xp installation on a much older desktop pc which takes several minutes to start up alone runs the program much faster.
Does anything sound familiar at all?
last last line was for you
ok
